title: Chrysler plans to be an all-electric carmaker by 2028
text:
The carmaker said Wednesday it would launch its first battery-electric vehicle by 2025, and unveiled a new crossover concept called the Chrysler Airflow at the CES technology show in Las Vegas.

The announcement provides a clue as to what Stellantis—the autos behemoth formed last year by the merger of Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV and France's PSA Group—plans to do with the storied American brand. The company houses many more car brands than most of its rivals, and analysts say some of its marques require greater focus and investment to improve their performance.

Chrysler, which was founded in 1925, now sells just two models to consumers—one minivan and a large sedan—far fewer than the number of nameplates it sold in showrooms a decade ago. And its U.S. sales have slid in recent years. The brand sold roughly 115,004 vehicles in 2021, about one-third of its volume in 2015, according to company figures.
